field.name: Feeding Problems with Persistent Diarrhoea | Take Action
Counsel mother/caregiver on feeding a sick child
If child still breastfeeds, observe mother breastfeeding and provide counseling on breast attachment and positioning, if necessary
Additional considerations when a child has persistent diarrhoea:
If child is still breastfeeding, give more frequent, longer breastfeeds, day and night
Replace with increased breastfeeding, if child is still breastfeeding OR
Replace half the milk with thick porridge
If child takes other foods, counsel mother/caregiver on feeding according to child’s age
Advise mother/caregiver when to return for care immediately
If child continues to have feeding problems, advise mother/caregiver to return for care in 5 days
 Record clinical care in Child Health Record “green” book
